derivation.yuyuan_name: from French fricassée, feminine past participle of fricasser 'cut up and cook in sauce' (probably a blend of frire 'to fry' and casser 'to break')

means.word_mean: 1. pieces of chicken or other meat stewed in gravy with e.g. carrots and onions and served with noodles or dumplings
1. make a fricassee of by cooking;
